blocks.name: ordon
blocks.content: The class of all ordinal numbers is ordinal. Proposition 7.12 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38, but without using the Axiom of Regularity. (Contributed by NM, 17-May-1994.)

blocks.name: onprc
blocks.content: No set contains all ordinal numbers. Proposition 7.13 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38, but without using the Axiom of Regularity. This is also known as the Burali-Forti paradox (remark in [Enderton] p. 194). In 1897, Cesare Burali-Forti noticed that since the "set" of all ordinal numbers is an ordinal class ( ~ ordon ), it must be both an element of the set of all ordinal numbers yet greater than every such element. ZF set theory resolves this paradox by not allowing the class of all ordinal numbers to be a set (so instead it is a proper class). Here we prove the denial of its existence. (Contributed by NM, 18-May-1994.)

blocks.name: ssorduni

blocks.name: ordsson
blocks.content: Any ordinal class is a subclass of the class of ordinal numbers. Corollary 7.15 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 38. (Contributed by NM, 18-May-1994.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 12-Aug-2011.)

blocks.name: onss
blocks.content: An ordinal number is a subset of the class of ordinal numbers. (Contributed by NM, 5-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: predon
blocks.content: For an ordinal, the predecessor under ` _E ` and ` On ` is an identity relationship. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 27-Mar-2011.)

blocks.name: ssonprc

blocks.name: oninton
blocks.content: The intersection of a nonempty collection of ordinal numbers is an ordinal number. Compare Exercise 6 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 44. (Contributed by NM, 29-Jan-1997.)

blocks.name: onintrab
blocks.content: The intersection of a class of ordinal numbers exists iff it is an ordinal number. (Contributed by NM, 6-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: onintrab2
blocks.content: An existence condition equivalent to an intersection's being an ordinal number. (Contributed by NM, 6-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: onnmin
blocks.content: No member of a set of ordinal numbers belongs to its minimum. (Contributed by NM, 2-Feb-1997.)

blocks.name: onnminsb
blocks.content: An ordinal number smaller than the minimum of a set of ordinal numbers does not have the property determining that set. ` ps ` is the wff resulting from the substitution of ` A ` for ` x ` in wff ` ph ` . (Contributed by NM, 9-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: sucon

  ordsuc(c0)
  sylibr(wa(word(csuc(c0)), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))), word(c1), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordelord(csuc(c0), csuc(c1))
  pm2.61i(wi(wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)))), wcel(c1, universe))
  ex(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))))
  3bitr4d(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1))), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0)))
  adantl(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))))
  ancoms(word(c0), word(c1), wb(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))))
  sylanb(word(c1), word(c0), wb(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))), word(csuc(c1)))
  ordsuc(c1)

  impbid(wa(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1))), wcel(c1, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0))
  ad2antrl(wcel(c1, universe), word(c0), word(c1), wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(csuc(c1), c0)))
  ordsucss(c0, c1)
  adantr(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wi(wss(csuc(c1), c0), wcel(c1, c0)))
  sucssel(c1, universe, c0)
  adantr(wcel(c1, universe), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))))
  sylbi(wcel(c1, universe), wb(wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wo(wcel(csuc(c1), c0), wceq(csuc(c1), c0))), wcel(csuc(c1), universe))
  elsucg(csuc(c1), universe, c0)
  a1d(wn(wcel(c1, universe)), wa(word(c0), word(c1)), wb(wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))))
  pm5.21ni(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c1, c0), wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)))
  elex(c1, c0)
  sylibr(wcel(csuc(c1), csuc(c0)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(csuc(c1), universe))
  elex(csuc(c1), csuc(c0))

}

blocks.name: ordsucsssuc
blocks.content: The subclass relationship between two ordinal classes is inherited by their successors. (Contributed by NM, 4-Oct-2003.)

blocks.name: ordunel
blocks.content: The maximum of two ordinals belongs to a third if each of them do. (Contributed by NM, 18-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: onsucuni
blocks.content: A class of ordinal numbers is a subclass of the successor of its union. Similar to Proposition 7.26 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 41. (Contributed by NM, 19-Sep-2003.)

blocks.name: ordsucuni

blocks.name: orduniorsuc

blocks.content: The class of ordinal numbers is a limit ordinal. (Contributed by NM, 24-Mar-1995.)

blocks.content: An ordinal number is a subset of ` On ` . (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-1994.)

blocks.name: onsuci
blocks.content: The successor of an ordinal number is an ordinal number. Corollary 7N(c) of [Enderton] p. 193. (Contributed by NM, 12-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: onuniorsuci
blocks.content: An ordinal number is either its own union (if zero or a limit ordinal) or the successor of its union. (Contributed by NM, 13-Jun-1994.)

blocks.name: onuninsuci
blocks.content: A limit ordinal is not a successor ordinal. (Contributed by NM, 18-Feb-2004.)

blocks.name: onsucssi
blocks.content: A set belongs to an ordinal number iff its successor is a subset of the ordinal number. Exercise 8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 42 and its converse. (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-1995.)
